text: Peter Werner Schutz (April 20, 1930 - October 29, 2017) was a German-American businessman. He served as the president and CEO of Porsche between 1981 and 1987, a time in which the company greatly expanded sales such as in the United States. He was a motivational speaker and co-founder of Harris and Schutz Inc.. Schutz was born in Berlin, Germany. His family moved to Havana, Cuba in 1937 after the rise of the Nazi Party. In 1939, his family moved to Chicago, Illinois where he was raised. He studied at the Illinois Institute of Technology. Schutz died in Naples, Florida of complications from Alzheimer's disease on October 29, 2017 at the age of 87.Peter Schutz, Executive Who Saved a Signature Porsche, Dies at 87 ==References== ==Other websites== * Serge Schmemann, "American to Depart As Head of Porsche", The New York Times, 17 December 1987 Category:1930 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Deaths from Alzheimer's disease Category:Disease-related deaths in Florida Category:German businesspeople Category:Naturalized citizens of the United States Category:Businesspeople from Chicago Category:People from Berlin
